result.namespace_description: List organizations

fields.name: since
fields.description: An organization ID. Only return organizations with an ID greater than this ID.

result.namespace_description: Get an organization
Update an organization

fields.name: billing_email
fields.description: Billing email address. This address is not publicized.

fields.name: twitter_username
fields.description: The Twitter username of the company.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The shorthand name of the company.

fields.name: has_organization_projects
fields.description: Toggles whether an organization can use organization projects.

fields.name: has_repository_projects
fields.description: Toggles whether repositories that belong to the organization can use repository projects.

fields.name: default_repository_permission
fields.description:
Default permission level members have for organization repositories:
* read - can pull, but not push to or administer this repository.
* write - can pull and push, but not administer this repository.
* admin - can pull, push, and administer this repository.
* none - no permissions granted by default.Default: read

fields.name: members_can_create_repositories
fields.description:
Toggles the ability of non-admin organization members to create repositories. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create repositories.
Default: true
Note: A parameter can override this parameter. See members_allowed_repository_creation_type in this table for details. Note: A parameter can override this parameter. See members_allowed_repository_creation_type in this table for details.Default:

fields.name: members_can_create_internal_repositories
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create internal repositories, which are visible to all enterprise members. You can only allow members to create internal repositories if your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create internal repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create internal repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization" in the GitHub Help documentation.

fields.name: members_can_create_private_repositories
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create private repositories, which are visible to organization members with permission. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create private repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create private repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization" in the GitHub Help documentation.

fields.name: members_can_create_public_repositories
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create public repositories, which are visible to anyone. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create public repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create public repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization" in the GitHub Help documentation.

fields.name: members_allowed_repository_creation_type
fields.description:
Specifies which types of repositories non-admin organization members can create. Can be one of:
* all - all organization members can create public and private repositories.
* private - members can create private repositories. This option is only available to repositories that are part of an organization on GitHub Enterprise Cloud.
* none - only admin members can create repositories.
Note: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Its return value ignores internal repositories. Using this parameter overrides values set in members_can_create_repositories. See the parameter deprecation notice in the operation description for details.

fields.name: members_can_create_pages
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create GitHub Pages sites. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create GitHub Pages sites.
* false - no organization members can create GitHub Pages sites. Existing published sites will not be impacted.Default:

fields.name: members_can_create_public_pages
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create public GitHub Pages sites. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create public GitHub Pages sites.
* false - no organization members can create public GitHub Pages sites. Existing published sites will not be impacted.Default:

fields.name: members_can_create_private_pages
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create private GitHub Pages sites. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create private GitHub Pages sites.
* false - no organization members can create private GitHub Pages sites. Existing published sites will not be impacted.Default:

fields.name: members_can_fork_private_repositories
fields.description:
Toggles whether organization members can fork private organization repositories. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can fork private repositories within the organization.
* false - no organization members can fork private repositories within the organization.

result.namespace_description: Get the audit log for an organization

fields.name: phrase
fields.description: A search phrase. For more information, see Searching the audit log.

fields.name: include
fields.description:
The event types to include:

web - returns web (non-Git) events.
git - returns Git events.
all - returns both web and Git events.

The default is web.

fields.name: after
fields.description: A cursor, as given in the Link header. If specified, the query only searches for events after this cursor.

fields.name: before
fields.description: A cursor, as given in the Link header. If specified, the query only searches for events before this cursor.

fields.name: order
fields.description:
The order of audit log events. To list newest events first, specify desc. To list oldest events first, specify asc.
The default is desc.

fields.name: login
fields.description: Limits the list of credentials authorizations for an organization to a specific login

result.namespace_description: Create an organization invitation

fields.name: invitee_id
fields.description: Required unless you provide email. GitHub user ID for the person you are inviting.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Required unless you provide invitee_id. Email address of the person you are inviting, which can be an existing GitHub user.

fields.name: role
fields.description:
Specify role for new member. Can be one of:
* admin - Organization owners with full administrative rights to the organization and complete access to all repositories and teams.
* direct_member - Non-owner organization members with ability to see other members and join teams by invitation.
* billing_manager - Non-owner organization members with ability to manage the billing settings of your organization.Default: direct_member

fields.name: team_ids
fields.description: Specify IDs for the teams you want to invite new members to.

result.namespace_description: Cancel an organization invitation
List organization invitation teams

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

result.namespace_description: List organization members

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Filter members returned in the list. Can be one of:
* 2fa_disabled - Members without two-factor authentication enabled. Available for organization owners.
* all - All members the authenticated user can see.Default: all

fields.name: role
fields.description:
Filter members returned by their role. Can be one of:
* all - All members of the organization, regardless of role.
* admin - Organization owners.
* member - Non-owner organization members.Default: all

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

Set organization membership for a user

fields.name: role
fields.description:
The role to give the user in the organization. Can be one of:
* admin - The user will become an owner of the organization.
* member - The user will become a non-owner member of the organization.Default: member

result.namespace_description: Remove organization membership for a user
List public organization members

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: state
fields.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, the API returns both active and pending memberships.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Required. The state that the membership should be in. Only "active" will be accepted.

* all: All outside collaborators.Default: all

result.namespace_description: Create an organization webhook

fields.name: config
fields.description: Required. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. These are defined below.

fields.name: Properties of theconfigobjectName (Type)Descriptionurl (string)Required. The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.content_type (string)The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.secret (string)If provided, the secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex digest value for delivery signature headers.insecure_ssl (string or number or )Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.username (string)password (string)
events
fields.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for.Default: push

fields.name: active
fields.description: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to true to send notifications.Default:

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: If provided, the secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex digest value for delivery signature headers.

fields.name: insecure_ssl
fields.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.
